articles.content:
Japan's Wild Ambition for Reinvasion under Fire 
     Tokyo, April 4 (KNS-KCNA) -- The Korean youth and students in Japan strongly denounce Japan's wild ambition to stage a comeback to Korea and will unite close with the youth and students in the north and the south and overseas in their resolute struggle to defend the national sovereignty, declared the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan in its statement on March 25.
 Accusing Japan of absurdly asserting that Tok Islet belongs to its territory, while distorting the hard historical fact, and kicking up a noisy row in quest of "dominium over the islet", the statement termed this a clear expression of its design to revive militarism and reinvade Korea.    
 We, as the descendents of victims of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea and the Korean youth in Japan who have suffered from the hostile policy of the Japanese government toward the Korean nation, can never tolerate such reckless remarks and acts of the Japanese rightwing reactionaries as wantonly insulting and infringing upon the sovereignty and dignity of the Korean nation, it stressed.

Aliyev Presents Credentials to Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Aliyev Presents Credentials to Kim Yong Nam
    Pyongyang, April 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Yashar Aliyev, Azerbaijan ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand was Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.    
 After getting the credentials, the president had a talk with the ambassador.
